verse.direction: During this scene, Natasha prepares to poison herself.

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: You promised Countess Rostova to marry her and were about to elope, is that so?

stanza.speaker: ANATOLE
stanza.line: Mon cher
I don’t consider myself bound to answer questions put to me in that tone

stanza.speaker: PIERRE

s-action.line: I seize you by the collar with my big big hands
And I shake you from side to side
Until your face shows a sufficient degree of terror

stanza.line: When I tell you I must talk to you!

stanza.speaker: ANATOLE
stanza.line: Come now, this is stupid!
What what, don’t don’t!

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: You’re a scoundrel and a blackguard
And I don’t know what deprives me of the pleasure
Of smashing your head in with this!

verse.direction: He takes a heavy paperweight and lifts it threateningly, but at once puts it back in its place.)

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: Did you promise to marry her?

stanza.speaker: ANATOLE
stanza.line: I didn’t think of it. I never promised, because—

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: Have you any letters of hers?
Any letters?
I shan’t be violent, don’t be afraid

verse.direction: Anatole hands Pierre a pack of letters.

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: First, the letters
Second, tomorrow you must get out of Moscow

stanza.speaker: ANATOLE
stanza.line: But how can I?

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: Third
You must never breathe a word of what has happened between you and the Countess
Now I know I can’t prevent your doing so
But if you have a spark of conscience—

s-action.line: Pierre paces the room several times in silence
Anatole sits at a table frowning and biting his lips

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: After all, you must understand
That besides your pleasure
There is such a thing as other people
And their happiness and peace
And that you are ruining a whole life
For the sake of amusing yourself!
Amuse yourself with women like my wife
With them you’re within your rights
But to promise a young girl to marry her
To deceive, to kidnap
Don’t you understand that that’s as cruel
As beating an old man or a child?

stanza.speaker: ANATOLE
stanza.line: Well, I don’t know about that, eh?
I don’t know that and I don’t want to
But you have used such words to me
“Scoundrel” and so on
Which as a man of honor
I will not allow anyone to use

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: Is it satisfaction you want?

stanza.speaker: ANATOLE
stanza.line: You could at least take back your words, eh?
If you want me to do as you wish?

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: Fine, I take them back, I take them back!
And I ask you to forgive me
And if you require money for your journey—

s-action.line: The reflection of that base and cringing smile
Which Pierre knew so well in his wife

stanza.speaker: PIERRE
stanza.line: Oh, vile and heartless brood!
